Incident.Summary: Motor vehicle collision into a structure resulting in a fatality.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
This case was captured on In-car camera (T-16) and Body Worn Camera (#6301).

Attachments:
MSP89B- Death Investigation Report
MSP91D-Vehicle Inventory Checklist

Evidence: 
13 (Thirteen) Color Images were captured and uploaded to this report.

 Narrative:

On 12/3/2023 at approximately 0130 hours, I, Senior Trooper Oyler #6301 of the Maryland State Police Leonardtown Barrack, responded for a motor vehicle collision into a structure at 21504 Exquisite Drive, Lexington Park, MD 20653. While responding St. Mary's County Dispatch updated incoming units that the caller advised the vehicle "just tapped" the trailer and there were no injuries.

Upon arrival at approximately 0134 hours, it became clear that the incident was much more severe than had been described. As I exited my unmarked patrol vehicle, I approached the car, a white Scion TC, MD registration 2FC3499, into a trailer home, and observed there was a driver trapped inside. I was able to reach my arm inside the vehicle enough to reach the driver to feel for a brachial pulse. When I could not feel a brachial pulse, I switched to feel for a carotid pulse, which there was none. I advised over the radio that there was no pulse. The operator of the vehicle appeared to be an un-belted male, wearing a t-shirt and sweat pants. I noted blood to his forehead, but no other signs of external trauma. There was apparent deformity to the steering wheel and the driver's seat, in addition to the front end damage to the vehicle. It should be noted that there was a tire, mounted on a wheel, on the passenger seat close to where the driver's head was resting, numerous large nails, glass, a car jack, and various other factors that made extrication impossible for first arriving units without protective gear. The fire department arrived a brief time later, extricated the driver from the vehicle, and began CPR. Reconstruction was requested. At 0153 hours EMS Chief Thomas Raley declared time of death. (EMS run number #15558). 

There was no ID on the victim and few of the witnesses spoke English well enough to be interviewed. There were two subjects inside the residence that were identified and provided their names and contact information, Ilsy Florian (DOB: 3/3/1989, 240-431-0162) and Francisco Arma Mazariegos Galicia (DOB: 1/21/1985, 240-431-8895). As more of the community was made aware of the situation, a neighbor came forward and said that they believed the driver lived at 46102 Pleasant Drive, Lexington Park, MD 20653. Additional law enforcement maintained control of the scene while I went to this address and contacted a subject by the name of Brenda Coembera (DOB: 7/15/1975, 240-431-2675). With help from her teenage son, I was able to speak to Coembera and confirm that the driver was the registered owner Julio Cesar Martinez (DOB:10/3/1965) and that he did reside at the Pleasant Drive address. Combera invited me into Martinez room and I was able to observe many beer bottles on the night stand and floor and music still playing on a phone in his bed. Photos of his room were taken and uploaded to this report. Coembera said that Martinez had a problem with alcohol, but no health problems. She also said that he had no family in the US and that they were the closest that he had to family. Due to the circumstances, I elected to make death notification to Coembera of Martinez's death. She and her family then accompanied me to the crash scene where they spoke with other members of the community about contacting his family over seas.

TFC Engleman responded for the reconstruction as well as FI Webber (OCME # 2314936). At the conclusion of the forensic investigation and reconstruction Brinsfield Funeral Home was contacted to transport the deceadants body to the OCME for autopsy.

PJ's Towing responded to remove the vehicle where it will be stored on a 72 hour hold for further reconstruction investigation.

Finally, The residence at 21504 Exquiste Drive was deemed unsound by the fire department and the family was displaced. They elected to self re-locate to a friends home at 21570 S. Essex Drive., Lexington Park, MD

An MSP 91D, Vehicle Inventory Checklist was completed and is attached to this report.

An MSP 89B, Death Investigation Report was completed the same day as this incident, emailed to homicide and the medical examiner and is attached to this report.

Case Closed.

Detailed Crash Investigation Supplement
(For review by the MSP Crash Team)




Section I. - Narrative

On Monday, December 4, 2023, at approximately 1426 hours, TFC J. Engleman requested I image the Airbag Control Module from the 2006 Scion TC involved in this collision. 

On Thursday, December 14, 2023, at approximately 1044 hours, I responded to PJ's Towing and Recovery located at 22348 Three Notch Road in Lexington Park, Maryland.  I located the Airbag Control Module in the Scion and obtained an image of the module via direct-to-module.

1.   Analysis of the Scion's EDR Data:
a.   Software recovered three events stored on the module.
b.   A review of the Data Limitations section did not reveal any known issues with the data.
c.   Most Recent Frontal/Rear Event, TRG 13
i.    Pre-Crash Data:
1.  The Scion experienced a maximum delta-V of -5.7 MPH at 150 milliseconds during the recording.  The driver buckle switch was listed as unbuckled.  Please refer to the Crash Data Retrieval System (CDR) report for further which is attached to this supplemental report.  

2.  1st Prior Frontal/Rear Event, TRG 12
i.    Pre-Crash Data:
1.  The Scion experienced a maximum delta-V of -2.9 MPH at 110 and 130 to 150 milliseconds during the recording.  The driver buckle switch was listed as unbuckled. 

3.   Prior Frontal/Rear Event, TRG 3
i.    Pre-Crash Data:
1.  The Scion experienced a maximum delta-V of -5.7 MPH at 150 milliseconds during the recording.  The driver buckle switch was listed as buckled.  This event was not part of the collision event that is under investigation due to the TRG number and the time was 5000 msec or greater.

The delta-V would be under-reported in this collision, as the vehicle struck a mobile home and there was an underside/override with the vehicle when it traveled partially under the mobile home.

Please refer to the Crash Data Retrieval System (CDR) report for further which is attached to this supplemental report.
 
Section II. - Attachments that were included in this report:

The following items were attached to this report: 

1. ACM/CDR Report

 
Conclusion:

This concludes my involvement in this investigation.

Sergeant Justin Zimmerman #3901
